intro: Rubus × multifidiformis, commonly known as the multifidiform bramble, is a hybrid plant belonging to the Rosaceae family. It is characterized by its thorny stems and compound leaves, which often have multiple leaflets. The plant produces small, aggregate fruits known as drupes, typically red or black in color. It thrives in temperate climates and is often found in woodland edges or disturbed soils. Due to its ornamental value and hardy nature, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
